# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

## Approach
1. Define the function `wrap_string` that takes a string and an optional parameter `text_width` with a default value of 10.
2. Split the input string into words.
3. Iterate through each word and construct lines such that adding a next word exceeds the `text_width`, then add a newline before that word.
4. Join these lines and return the result.

## Code

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s)
    line = ""
    current_length = 0

    for word in words
        if current_length + length(word) > text_width
            line *= "\n"
            current_length = 0
        elseif current_length > 0
            line *= " "
            current_length += 1
        end
        line *= word
        current_length += length(word)
    end
    
    return line
end

# Example
println(wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines"))
```

This function starts a new line before adding a word that would exceed the maximum text width of 10 characters. Note that this implementation doesn't account for words themselves that exceed the text width; they are not split but included wholly on a new line.
